title: 115_hr1380
content: The "Timber Innovation Act of 2017" may be cited as the short title for this Act. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The "Timber Innovation Act of 2017" defines key terms such as innovative wood product, mass timber, Secretary, and tall wood building. The "Timber Innovation Act of 2017" defines a tall wood building as a structure designed to be constructed with mass timber and exceeding 85 feet in height. SEC. 3. CLARIFICATION OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM FOR WOOD BUILDING CONSTRUCTION. The Secretary conducts research, education, and technical assistance to promote innovative wood products in construction. Activities include collaboration with industry and conservation organizations to achieve performance goals. The Secretary collaborates with industry and conservation organizations to provide competitive grants to higher education institutions for research, development, education, and technical assistance in achieving measurable performance goals. Priority areas include improving commercialization of innovative wood products, analyzing safety of tall wood building materials, calculating environmental footprint of tall wood construction, and reducing life cycle impacts. The Secretary collaborates with industry and conservation organizations to provide grants for research, development, education, and technical assistance in priority areas such as improving commercialization of innovative wood products, analyzing safety of tall wood building materials, calculating environmental footprint of tall wood construction, reducing life cycle impacts, and other research areas identified by the Secretary. Measurable performance goals should be achievable within a 5-year timeframe. The Secretary conducts a tall wood building design competition annually from 2017 to 2021, as per the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act. Additionally, a Wood Innovation Grant Program is established. The Secretary, through the Wood Innovation Grant Program, may provide grants to eligible entities such as individuals, public or private entities, and State, local, or tribal governments. The Secretary is defined as the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service. The Wood Innovation Grant Program may award grants to eligible entities for advancing innovative wood products. Priority is given to proposals using existing sawmill facilities in high-unemployment counties. Recipients must match the grant amount with non-Federal funds.
